com.esri.mo2.data.feat
Class BaseCursor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.data.feat.BaseCursor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cursor
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseFilterCursor, EmptyCursor, IteratorCursor, SelectionCursor, ShapefileCursor, ShapefileSelectionSetCursor
public abstract class BaseCursor
extends Object
implements Cursor

Provides a simple way to build a Cursor that uses a "peek" strategy. When a subclass is constructed, it should call its implementation of the peek method.

This class provides a hasMore() that tests for the most recent result of the peek method being null, and a next method which returns the most recent result of peek after calling peek once more.

Note: The constructor for a subclass of BaseCursor must call the peek after all other initialization has been completed. If you forget to call this method, the result will be an empty Cursor, as the value of _next will be null, and the first call to the hasMore method will return False.

Method Detail

peek

protected abstract void peek()
subclasses must implement this method to update the value of _next. _next should be set to the null value if no more data is available

Specified by:

Returns:

finalize

protected void finalize()
this method calls dispose(). So you don't have to clean up Cursor resources, but it is a good idea to call dispose() anyway, when you are finished with a Cursor, because the Garbage Collector is not guaranteed to finalize classes at any particular time.

Overrides:
finalize in class Object

public void dispose()
Does nothing, subclasses should override this method if any special cleanup is required.
